value.0:
INSTRUCTIONS

You will need:
Creature Swarm - Located in the Item palette, under Tutorial.
Swarm Summon Template - Located in the NPC palette, under Tutorial. It has a space in front of it, so it's near the top.

Use the Swarm Summon Template creature to create up to three creatures for the swarm. These creatures will make up the summoned swarm evenly. Do not change the scripts, as this will ensure they act appropriately as henchmen and will unsummon when the player logs out, dies, removes the creatures from party, etc. You can use the ds_ai_vfx_1 int variable to set a vfx for the creature, because it uses ds_ai2_spawn. It will carry over the local variables. You can change the creature's race to be more accurate if you like, too, but don't change stats, skills, etc. You can change everything else, including alignment, voicesets, clothing for dynamic creatures, name, bio, and portrait. Everything aesthetic is fair game!

Follow these steps afterward:

--- Use the widget on each creature, one after the other. It will tell you when the maximum (3) is reached. The first creature you use it on will determine the name given to the widget.
--- Use the widget on itself to finalize the swarm. This will change the name and the bio, as well as replace the Unique Power to be Self-Only.
--- OPTIONAL: Set the qty string variable on the swarm widget lower than 15 if the player only wants to summon 5, for example. Do not set it higher than 15.
--- Give the widget to the player.


IMPORTANT: This widget copies the creature exactly as it is made. Make sure to use the template creature, because it will summon 15 of whatever you set it to.
